p: Studies outlined that transmissibility of transient microbial flora depends on the specific species present as well as the number of microorganisms on the surface [ 7, 8]. A 2008 study investigating the hand-based microbiome of 51 healthy adult volunteers found that on average an individual had more than 150 bacterial species, of which, 94% belonged to the Proteobacteria, Firmicutes and Actinobacteria phyla [ 9]. A study exploring human hand bacterial and fungal microbiome diversity discovered Malassezia spp. and Aspergillus spp. as the most common and second most common fungal microorganisms, respectively [ 10].
